710559f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 39th Street
710559f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue, west side, from 39th to 40th Streets.
October 31, 193
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

710557f-b.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 39th Street
710557f-b.text:
(1)
Tenth Avenue, at and adjoining the N.E. Corner of 39th Street.
5l8 Tenth Avenue,on the right, is the corner house. The centre
house, 520 Tenth avenue, 1s a three-story frame house with a
brick front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection,Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 501.
(2)
A rear view of the frame house shown in No. 1.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 502.

712593f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - 10th Avenue
712593f-a.text:
39th Street, north side, from and including Tenth Avenue towards
Eleventh avenue, showing the old David Stevenson brewery at
521 Tenth Avenue.
February 5, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

710561f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 39th Street
710561f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue, east side, from 39th to 41st Streets.
September 1, 1934.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

712585f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (West) - 10th Avenue
712585f-a.text:
440-456 West 39th Street, south side, west from a
point east of Tenth Avenue and towards same, showing tene-
ments and a loft building that were subsequently demolished.
The factory structure bears No. 448-50 and was occupied by
Owen Wards Sons. The low white building partially shown at
the right margin is No. 516 Tenth Avenue. This is at the
S.E. corner.
August, 1934
Gift of Samuel Landsman
Arverne. Long Island

710556f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue at S.E. corner of 39th Street.
September 1, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, after demolition of the entire western half of
the block. The Empire State building, only the very top
of which is visible in the 1934 view, is now clearly revea
May 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

P. L. Sperr.

712586f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - 10th Avenue
712586f-a.text:
457, 455 West 39th Street, adjoining the N.E. corner of Tenth
Avenue.
March 18, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

712588f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (West) - 10th Avenue
712588f-a.text:
West 39th Street, north side, east from Tenth Avenue, showing
vacant lots and tenement interspersed. The church structure at
No. 451 is a renovated 4 story 'building and is occupied by the
Church of St. George (Greek Orthodox). Overhead an aviator is
advertising for a popular Fifth Avenue fur house. M.J. Fox & Co.'
No. 2 shows details of this view. The McGraw-Hill Bldg.
appears across the roof of the Church in same.
Pe. 10, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,

712588f-b.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (West) - 10th Avenue
712588f-b.text:
West 39th Street, north side, east from Tenth Avenue, showing
vacant lots and tenement interspersed. The church structure at

710555f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 39th Street
710555f-a.text:
A two-story frame structure at the rear of 514 Tenth Avenue,
adjoining the S.E. corner of 39th Street. This will be demolished
in 1935.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 516.

733454f.title: Transportation - Railroads - New York Central Railroad - Engine and train.
733454f.text:
Transportation: A N. Y. C. R. R. engine and train on
Tenth Avenue at W. 39th Street. This thoroughfare was one of
those populariy known as "Railroad Avenue" because of their
use by the R. R. Co. Subsequent to 1w33, they will use a
continuous elevated highway south of this point. Northward
an undercut will be utilined. This is a portion of the West
Side Improvement Project. For photos, see files under said
classification and the various thoroughfares, as Tenth, Eleventh,
and Twelfth Avenues.
About 1930
Views 1-4
P. L. Sperr

712587f-b.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (West) - 10th Avenue
712587f-b.text:
(1)
459-443 West 39th Street, adjoining N.E. corner of Tenth Avenue,
seen across the clearing from 38th Street.
No. 45l is a new Greek Orthodox Church, St. George.

(2)
Showing a closer view of St. George Greek Orthodox Church at No. 451.
August 31, 1934.

(3)

December 10, 1937.
. Sperr.  No REPRODucTIoNS.

712590f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - 10th Avenue
712590f-a.text:
No's. 535 to 529 W. 39th Street, north side, between
Eieventh and Tenth Avenues, as viewed northeastward to show
beyond the afore-enurerated buildings the new cut contairing
the roadbed of the New York Central Railroad.
Ap.aratus shown is clearing the rock from same onto a
track to be hauled away.
May 1, 1936.
P.L. Sperr
